summary: "American Graffiti" is a 1973 comedy-drama film about a group of teenagers in Modesto, California, in 1962. Directed by George Lucas, it explores their adventures over one night, showcasing the cruising and rock 'n' roll cultures of the time. Despite initial rejection, the film became a huge success, earning critical acclaim and making over $200 million. Shot in Petaluma, California, it was the first film produced by Lucasfilm. It's now preserved in the National Film Registry.
title: American Graffiti
